name: Introduction to Journalism
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of journalism, including news gathering, writing, and editing.

name: Reporting for Mass Media
description: This course covers the basics of news and feature writing and reporting for newspapers, magazines, radio, television, and the internet.

name: Media Law and Ethics
description: This course covers legal and ethical issues related to newsgathering and reporting, including libel, copyright, and freedom of information laws.

name: Media Research and Analysis
description: This course covers the fundamentals of research for media professionals, including methods for gathering, analyzing, and presenting information.

name: Introduction to Community Journalism
description: This course provides an introduction to the principles of community journalism. Topics include news gathering techniques, interviewing, and reporting to serve a local community.

name: Community Journalism Ethics
description: This course examines the ethical issues associated with community journalism. Topics include accuracy, fairness, objectivity, and professionalism.

name: Advanced Community Journalism
description: This course provides an advanced understanding of community journalism. Topics include in-depth coverage, investigative reporting, and multimedia journalism.
